intro: Onosma nydeggeri, commonly known as the Nydegger's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in arid environments. It has small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Onosma nydeggeri is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions, making it a resilient and drought-tolerant species.
